improvement_suggestions: Broaden the YARA rule by using wildcards (`?`) within the patterns to allow for flexibility in the instruction sequence. Also, change the `condition` to `all of them` to `any of them` to trigger on any of the patterns.

Relax the patterns using wildcards (`?`) to allow for slight variations in the instruction sequence.  Also, change the condition to `all of them` to `one of them` to make it more resilient. This will allow the rule to match variations of the code sequence.

Broaden the patterns using wildcards (`?`) to allow for variations in register usage and memory addresses.  Specifically, the addresses used in `lea` instructions (e.g., `lea r9, qword ptr [rbp+00000190h]`) are likely to change.  Also, remove or significantly adjust the `cape_options` as the `skip` functionality might be causing issues. Instead of skipping, focus on matching the core logic.
